history.content: hello, cs70 and 61c by itself is quite a bit of work, and there is good overlap between ieor 172/173 and the second part of cs70 but the first 7 weeks of school would be a formidable 3 technical pset a week grind (+ midterms). Ieor classes are 3 units for a reason though, there's not as much content covered, but along with 2 CS classes, things could get hairy. However, if you are trying to minor in something, I imagine you think you're comfortable taking more techs, just get ready for the pset grind. 172 took 6 hours a week and 70 took upwards of 10-15 hours a week for me. 61c is similar to 61b in that you get projects that could really time consuming. lmk if u have other questions

I am an EECS freshman who will have completed CS61A/B and EE16A/B by the end of this semester. 

For next semester, I am planning to take CS61C and/or CS70. I also wanted to pick up a minor in IEOR but wanted to take a class first to see if I would like it. If I were to take Ind Eng 172 or Ind Eng 165 along with CS70&61C, would it be too difficult to manage? Does anyone have experience with IEOR classes and information about its time commitment/difficulty?
history.subject: Course Suggestion
